publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-405.1 Murdo Fraser: Army Display in the Parliamentâ€”As an amendment to motion (S2M-405) in the name of Frances Curran, leave out from "opposition" to end and insert "support for the army recruiting and information stall in the foyer of the Parliament HQ building; welcomes the promotion of military service as a career option for our young people, equipping them with vital skills which will be of use in later life, and pays tribute to the selfless service of our troops in defending our national interest and our freedoms over many years and most recently in Iraq."
S2M-405.1 Army Display in the Parliament (lodged on 24 September 2003) Mr Jamie Stone*, Alex Johnstone*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Bill Aitken*, Alex Fergusson*

S2M-405.1 Murdo Fraser: Army Display in the Parliament-As an amendment to motion (S2M-405) in the name of Frances Curran, leave out from "opposition" to end and insert "support for the army recruiting and information stall in the foyer of the Parliament HQ building; welcomes the promotion of military service as a career option for our young people, equipping them with vital skills which will be of use in later life, and pays tribute to the selfless service of our troops in defending our national interest and our freedoms over many years and most recently in Iraq." Supported by: Mr Jamie Stone, Alex Johnstone, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Bill Aitken, Alex Fergusson, Christine May*, Phil Gallie*, David Mundell*, Mike Rumbles*
S2M-405.1 Army Display in the Parliament (lodged on 24 September 2003) Mr David Davidson*
S2M-405.1 Army Display in the Parliament (lodged on 24 September 2003) Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-405.1 Army Display in the Parliament (lodged on 24 September 2003) Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-405.1 Army Display in the Parliament (lodged on 24 September 2003) John Scott*
S2M-405.1 Army Display in the Parliament (lodged on 24 September 2003) Mary Scanlon*
